meanings.definition: To mix or blend different elements or races together.
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to mongrelize different cuisines to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent2: The artist wanted to mongrelize different art styles in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was to mongrelize various music genres for a fun night.
meanings.sent4: Her novel aimed to mongrelize reality and fantasy seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The experiment sought to mongrelize different chemicals for a new compound.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become mixed or impure.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the paint cans open will mongrelize the colors over time.
meanings.sent2: The rain started to mongrelize the neat rows of sandcastles on the beach.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally spilling the drinks will mongrelize the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The gossip mongrelized the peaceful atmosphere in the office.
meanings.sent5: The pollution continued to mongrelize the purity of the river water.
